page.title: 13Cottages in Beverstone.
page.content: Most of the village of Beverstone straggles alongside the A.4153 although some other houses can be found by turning off one of the side roads in the village,either to the left or to the right.The cottages are attractive,two storey,buildings built of local stone.They all have well-tended gardens which are a blaze of colour in the summer.Many of the cottages were built in the 1840's when the local landowner employed Lewis Vulliamy,the architect of the mansion at Westonbirt,to design them.This explains why many of the cottages are similar,with their Gothic porches, bargeboards and finials.The same sort of cottages can be found in the village of Westonbirt.
